abstract: While the initial curiosity behind a Charlie Sheen-less "Two and a Half Men" seems to be fading, the CBS comedy was still able to reach 17.3 million viewers on Monday night, narrowly beating ABC's "Dancing With the Stars" (16.5 million) as the most-watched program.
snippet: While the initial curiosity behind a Charlie Sheen-less "Two and a Half Men" seems to be fading, the CBS comedy was still able to reach 17.3 million viewers on Monday night, narrowly beating ABC's "Dancing With the Stars" (16.5 million) as the...
lead_paragraph: While the initial curiosity behind a Charlie Sheen-less "Two and a Half Men" seems to be fading, the CBS comedy was still able to reach 17.3 million viewers on Monday night, narrowly beating ABC's "Dancing With the Stars" (16.5 million) as the most-watched program. On Fox, "Terra Nova" retained 100 percent of its premiere 18-to-49-year-old audience, a fantastic sign for the expensive sci-fi program. Meanwhile, the fall season had its first network casualty on Tuesday when NBC announced that it had canceled "The Playboy Club" after its third episode fell to just 3.4 million viewers.

headline.main: No Sheen, No Problem for 'Two and a Half Men'
